snippet: Lei Feng, a Chinese soldier who was lionized as a national role model in the 1960s by Mao Zedong, is making a comeback. The Communist Party, under fire for corruption and malfeasance in its ranks, has dusted off the legend of Lei Feng from its...
abstract: Lei Feng, a Chinese soldier who was lionized as a national role model in the 1960s by Mao Zedong, is making a comeback. The Communist Party, under fire for corruption and malfeasance in its ranks, has dusted off the legend of Lei Feng from its archives, although the propaganda campaign featuring the selfless young infantryman has been met with little more than a shrug.

headline.main: A Chinese Hero, Taken Off the Shelf, Is Met With Cynicism
